original_table_html:
Market share (%) Penetration (annual) (%) Loyalty-related metrics
Average purchase frequency Share of category requirements (%)
Regular 72 63 5 74
Light 20 32 3 33
Unscented 4 9 2 28
Stainguard 3 9 1.7 19
Average 2.9 39
summary_markdown: This data presents a comparative analysis of different customer segments based on their market share, penetration, and loyalty metrics. The primary segments analyzed are "Regular," "Light," and "Unscented," alongside a specific brand, "Stainguard," with an overall "Average" also calculated. "Regular" customers exhibit the highest market share (72%) and penetration (63%), coupled with the highest average purchase frequency (5) and share of category requirements (74%). Conversely, "Unscented" customers represent a smaller segment with lower market share (4%) and penetration (9%), but a notable share of category requirements (28%) despite a lower purchase frequency (2). "Light" customers fall in between, with a 20% market share and 32% penetration, a purchase frequency of 3, and a 33% share of category requirements. "Stainguard" shows a 3% market share and 9% penetration, with a purchase frequency of 1.7 and a 19% share of category requirements. The overall average indicates a purchase frequency of 2.9 and a 39% share of category requirements across all segments.
